intro: Hieracium farreiceps, commonly known as the Farre's hawkweed, is a flowering plant in the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its yellow to orange flowers and is native to the mountainous regions of southern Europe. The plant typically grows in alpine and subalpine habitats, preferring well-drained soils. It has a rosette of basal leaves and produces a single stem with numerous flowering heads. Due to its specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species in many areas.
